business.headline: Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

Reliance wins US licence for Venezuelan oil as India wavers on Russia supplyReliance applied for the licence in early January as India looks to diversify its energy purchases. Direct purchase of Venezuelan oil will help Reliance replace Russian oil in a cost-effective way.

Cheque bounced? How one mistake can spiral into legal and financial troubleA bounced cheque may seem like a minor slip, but it can quickly trigger penalties, credit damage and even legal complications. What starts as a simple payment error can snowball into a serious financial setback. Are you aware of the risks?

8th Pay Commission: Government seeks public feedback; who can participateThe recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to influence future salary structures, allowances and pension benefits for central government staff.

Gold, silver prices rise slightly: Rise ahead or fall on the cards?After days of volatility, gold and silver have posted modest gains, catching the attention of investors. The small rise has reopened a familiar debate, i.e., are precious metals preparing for another climb, or is a fresh dip still possible?

RBI steps in to stop mis-selling by banks: Decoding what's good and what's not clearThe Reserve Bank of India has signalled its intent after years of rising mis-selling complaints. But will this draft protect ordinary customers before the next grievance is filed? In this article, we break down what changes, what remains unclear, and whether enforcement can finally make a difference.

65-10-10-15 rule: How a 4-asset 'boring thali' portfolio helps in uncertain marketsWhen markets feel uncertain and investors struggle to decide where to put their money, a simple multi-asset strategy is drawing attention. Instead of chasing trends, the 65-10-10-15 "boring thali" approach focusses on balance and steady investing.

Is it the end of the road for silver after a spectacular rally?After a stunning rally and an equally sharp fall, silver now sits at a crucial crossroads, leaving investors wondering whether this correction is nearing its end or still gathering momentum.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 3:16 pm, the Sensex was down 1055.91 points to 82,619.01, while the Nifty stood at 25,481.35, lower by 325.85 points. The fall was led by heavy selling in IT stocks, but the triggers lie largely in global developments.

TCS, Infosys sink nearly 6%: 3 reasons why IT stocks are falling againShares of TCS and Infosys fell nearly 6% in early trade, dragging the Nifty IT index lower. The weakness was not driven by any one company-specific announcement. Instead, it reflects a mix of global triggers and rising uncertainty around how artificial intelligence will reshape the industry.

Sensex drops 700 points as AI panic hits IT stocks; Infosys, TCS drop 5%The Sensex fell over 700 points in early trade, while the Nifty slipped below the 25,600 mark. The decline was led by frontline technology majors such as Infosys and TCS, along with other large-cap IT names.

Retail inflation at 2.75% in January as India shifts to new CPI base year 2024The data, released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, reflects a major statistical overhaul aimed at making India's inflation measure more representative of current consumption patterns.

A 90-year-old man was sold a 100-year policy. Why blaming the bank is not enoughHandcrafted ByOur Editors A 90-year-old man was sold an insurance policy maturing in 2124. The case sounds bizarre. But instances of mis-selling like this are painfully common across the country. The bank resolved the matter after a viral social media post. The harder question is why blaming the bank alone is not enough.

Sensex sinks over 500 points, Nifty tumbles as AI panic sinks IT stocksThe benchmark BSE Sensex fell 559 points to close at 85,674.92, while the Nifty 50 slipped below the psychologically important 25,900 mark.

Aviation body writes to government as it bids to tighten cabin crew fatigue ruleThe Federation of Indian Airlines (FIA) has asked the government to dilute parts of the draft rules. The industry body represents IndiGo and Air India, and has raised concerns that the changes may create operational and cost pressures.

IT stocks crack under global AI pressure. Is this a buying chance?The Nifty IT index fell 4.67% by 12 PM, hitting a four-month low. The selloff wiped out nearly Rs 1.3 lakh crore in combined market value in a single session. The IT pack on the Sensex was also down nearly 5%.

Inflation data reset: Why your groceries will matter less than your rentOnion or tomato prices will no longer dominate inflation headlines. With rent and services gaining weight, the new data reset could quietly shape your EMIs, savings returns and everyday financial decisions. Read on to understand what has changed and why it matters for your wallet.

entertainment.headline: Anurag Kashyap slams social media backlash against critics of Dhurandhar Anurag Kashyap condemned the coordinated backlash against critics of Dhurandhar. He said that he was among the few industry members who shared the Film Critics Guild's statement addressing "targeted attacks, harassment, and hate directed toward film critics.

Inside Farhan Akhtar's Don 3 dilemma and legacy that won't fade away Don 3 continues to dominate the buzz despite casting shake-ups and prolonged delays. From Hrithik Roshan denying involvement to the uncertainty around Ranveer Singh and Kiara Advani, the franchise remains in flux under Farhan Akhtar's direction.

Sunny Leone: Working with Anurag Kashyap on Kennedy a career-changing experience Sunny Leone said Kennedy could be a turning point in her career, helping change the industry's perception of her as an actor.

Chiranjeevi reveals first photo and names of Ram Charan's twins Chiranjeevi posted the first pictures of Ram Charan and Upasana's newborn twins, sharing their names and heartfelt meanings in a family gathering.

When Shanaya Kapoor caught her ex texting 5 women: He gave me guilty earrings Actor Shanaya Kapoor has revealed details of a past relationship in which she caught her then-boyfriend messaging several other women. The revelation came during her appearance on the podcast.

Tamannaah Bhatia, Junaid Khan team up for Ektaa Kapoor's Ragini 3 Tamannah Bhatia and Junaid Khan are set to lead Ektaa Kapoor's horror film Ragini 3. The upcoming film will be directed by Shashanka Ghosh.

Pop titans BTS is back and bringing ARIRANG to the big screen BTS are making a grand comeback with their ARIRANG tour, which fans can watch not just in stadiums but also in cinemas, through livestreams and on Netflix.

Karan Johar has a warning for couples watching Tu Yaa Main on Valentine's Day Filmmaker Karan Johar posted a detailed review on Instagram after watching Tu Ya Main. The film, directed by Bejoy Nambiar and starring Shanaya Kapoor and Adarsh Gourav, released in cinemas on February 13.

Rajpal Yadav has paid Rs 2.5 crore of Rs 11 crore: Lawyer in cheque-bounce case The Delhi High Court has adjourned Rajpal Yadav's bail hearing to February 16 in a long-standing cheque bounce case. The actor's lawyer said that he has paid part of his debt.

Was never approached for Don 3: Hrithik sets record straight on Farhan Akhtar film Hrithik Roshan has dismissed rumours of joining Don 3, clarifying that he was never approached for Farhan Akhtar's upcoming film. The actor addressed reports suggesting he would replace Ranveer Singh in the third instalment of the popular franchise.

While his previous films worked, his third film leaves you with a bitter aftertaste.
What a Qasainuma Edit: Dhurandhar-inspired viral fan post wins Aditya Dhar praise Aditya Dhar praised a fan-made Dhurandhar edit, adding to the film's growing social media buzz.

Armaan Malik reacts to Arijit's retirement: He has given his all to the industry Armaan Malik reacted to the retirement of a leading playback singer, praising his monumental contribution to the industry. Respecting the decision to step away from new assignments, Armaan emphasised that artists are entitled to make personal choices for their careers.

O'Romeo X reviews: Fans praise Shahid's intensity but slam sluggish screenplay Vishal Bhardwaj's O'Romeo opened to mixed reactions from audiences, who praised the raw intensity of the lead actors but criticised the sluggish pacing. While some enjoyed the retro vibe and action, others found the three-hour runtime hollow and the screenplay generic.

My body was the toughest real estate: Shahid Kapoor on O' Romeo makeover Shahid Kapoor revealed that O' Romeo demanded his "toughest" body makeover, with hours spent applying tattoos and filming challenging action sequences after hip surgery.

O' Romeo review: Shahid Kapoor-Vishal Bhardwaj fail to recreate Haider, Kaminey magicRelease Date:Fri Feb 13, 2026 In O' Romeo, Vishal Bhardwaj crafts a visually stunning gangster-romance led by Shahid Kapoor. However, despite poetic frames and intense performances, the film struggles with an uneven screenplay and an underwhelming emotional pay-off.

Himani Shivpuri reunites with Salman Khan, says his mischievous twinkle is intact Veteran actor Himani Shivpuri recently caught up with Salman Khan, sharing a nostalgic photo. Their reunion brought back memories of their popular films and left fans eager for more stories.

Sudhanshu Pandey gives tribute to Lord Shiva, explains why he avoided playing Mahakaal Actor Sudhanshu Pandey paid a divine tribute to Lord Shiva by lending his voice for a devotional song. In his heartwarming social media note, the Anupamaa actor even explained why he skipped playing Mahakaal on screen.

Aparshakti Khurana says interviewing SRK as RJ was a turning point in his career Aparshakti Khurana reflected on his journey from radio jockey to Bollywood actor. He also revisited his memorable interview with Shah Rukh Khan, calling it a defining moment from a time when he hadn't planned an acting career.

general news.headline: AIADMK's 'coffin dance' jab at Vijay after man dies at his Tamil Nadu rallyThe AIADMK took a swipe at TVK chief Vijay after a man died due to a heatstroke at his Salem rally, saying that people should carry a coffin to attend his rallies in the future.

Why Nehru pushed Panchsheel pact with China? Defence chief explainsChief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan raised the Panchsheel Agreement on Friday, bringing into focus the tense border issues with China. Chauhan said Nehru assumed that the pact would settle the northern border row, but China had different views.

What Tarique Rahman 2.0 means for India, Hindus in BangladeshTarique Rahman is set to become the next prime minister of Bangladesh after his BNP swept the elections. For Tarique, repairing relations with India will be a priority. But the Hasina factor may well be an irritant. In this article, we explore what a new version of Tarique means for India.

The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Bangladesh leader who threatened to cut off Seven Sisters, wins big. Who's he?The NCP's Hasnat Abdullah, who played a big role in bringing down the Sheikh Hasina regime and has a history of issuing inflammatory remarks on India, has won the Comilla-4 seat in Bangladesh elections by a huge margin. Here's all about Abdullah, who threatened to cut off India's northeastern states and demanded a ban on Iskcon.

AI job disruptions are real - Matt Shumer warns it's coming faster than you thinkFor many Indians, AI still doesn't translate into a turning point. But as Hyperwrite CEO Matt Shumer's warning suggests, the real disruption may not arrive as mass layoffs, it may quietly reshape work, determining who adapts and who gets hired. The bigger question is whether India's degrees, skills, and hiring systems are keeping pace with a job market already being rewritten by AI.

When an astronaut played golf on the Moon with a smuggled clubheadAlan Shepard's playful experiment captured something equally important about exploration: the unmistakably human urge to improvise, joke, and celebrate achievement, even 3,80,000 kilometers from Earth.

What Tarique Rahman's BNP said about India after Bangladesh winBNP leader Nazrul Islam Khan thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for congratulating Tarique Rahman on the party's decisive parliamentary victory in Bangladesh, saying bilateral ties would strengthen under Rahman's leadership.

Epstein dossier revives focus on Madeleine McCann, British child missing since 2007The release of the Epstein dossier has reignited online debate after Madeleine McCann's name appeared in a single, unverified witness statement.

When told about shutdown, Claude AI was ready to blackmail and murder engineerCall it smart. Or dangerous. Anthropic has again confirmed that its Claude AI can veer off the rails. The company notes this in its safety report for the latest Claude 4.6. Earlier, Claude 4.5 was willing to blackmail and even harm an engineer to avoid shutdown.

How Nasa still talks to Voyager that has left Solar System foreverVoyager 1 is transmitting data from 24 billion kilometres away using less than 200 watts of power. Discover how Nasa engineers maintain this 48-year-old spacecraft in interstellar space.

Condom crisis at Winter Olympics: 10,000 packs at Games Village gone in 3 daysThe Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics athletes' village has reportedly run out of its free condom supply within just three days. From dissent to frontline: Shashi Tharoor gets Congress's key Kerala election roleDays after reconciling with the party leadership, Shashi Tharoor has been appointed co-chairman of Congress's Kerala campaign committee.

India used to study kissing in the Vedic Age, so why are we prudish now?Kissing is often labelled a Western import, but history tells a different story. From Vedic texts to Khajuraho sculptures and the Kama Sutra, India documented and studied the art of intimacy centuries ago. New global research on kissing only makes this cultural irony sharper and more fascinating.

Bihar dancer hospitalised after crowd shoves coins into her mouth during showThe incident occurred at a local cultural programme in Chandwa Tola area. According to eyewitnesses, the performer was entertaining a large crowd when some spectators climbed onto the stage in excitement and allegedly forced coins into her mouth.

After India's spin struggles against Namibia, Hardik Pandya asks for flatter wicketsIndia all-rounder Hardik Pandya opened up on the challenges of batting on a tricky surface at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi following India's 93-run victory against Namibia. Pandya was adjudged Player of the Match for his all-round performance in the fixture.

Bhopal 11th-grader gangraped in four cars, filmed, threatened with consequencesThe main accused, Ausaf Ali Khan, was arrested on February 3 and is currently in jail. China's Seedance 2 Video AI goes viral, people say Hollywood is now in dangerThere's a new AI model in town from China, and this one is taking on Hollywood. Seedance 2.0, the latest generative AI model from ByteDance, is helping users create highly realistic videos with cinematic shots. It is so good at its job that many are already calling it a "Hollywood killer."

sports.headline: USA vs Netherlands live score and updates from Chennai United States of America (USA) vs Netherlands (NED) Live score, T20 World Cup: The United States are in a must-win position as a loss would knock them out of the competition.

After Zimbabwe shocker, Australia dented with fresh injury concern T20 World Cup, AUS vs ZIM: Marcus Stoinis sustained a hand injury against Zimbabwe while attempting to stop a ball off his own bowling. He was unable to complete his third over and later came out to bat at No. 7 in Colombo.

Zimbabwe beating Australia guarantee India's T20 World Cup win? Here's what history says Zimbabwe secured a historic victory over Australia in the T20 World Cup 2026. This win raises hopes for India's success in the ongoing tournament, given their historic record.

IPL 2026: Riyan Parag replaces Sanju Samson as Rajasthan Royals captain Riyan Parag has been named captain of Rajasthan Royals for IPL 2026, marking the beginning of a new chapter for the franchise after Sanju Samson's switch to Chennai Super Kings.

Blessing curses Australia as Zimbabwe produce first big upset at T20 World Cup T20 World Cup 2026: Blessing Muzarabani led an inspired bowling effort from Zimbabwe as they bowled Australia out for 146, falling short of the total by 23 runs in Colombo. The former champions are in danger of exiting the tournament as early as the group stages.

I-League rebranded to Indian Football League, 10 teams confirm participation AIFF has officially rebranded the I-League as the Indian Football League starting from the 2025-26 season. The move coincides with the confirmation of participating teams and ongoing disputes over club promotions.

Sunil Gavaskar spells out Sanju Samson's problem before Pakistan clash T20 World Cup 2026: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar spelt out a technical flaw he believes Sanju Samson is battling as he tries to recover from a lean patch. The Kerala wicketkeeper was dismissed for an eight-ball 22 in India's win over Namibia on Thursday in Delhi.

If Usman Tariq pauses, you pull out: R Ashwin's bold take could spice up IND vs PAKT20 World Cup: Former India spinner R Ashwin has suggested a bold tactic to counter Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq ahead of the IND vs PAK clash on February 15. Ashwin believes it could unsettle Pakistan's biggest spin threat.

Riyan Parag set to be named Rajasthan Royals captain: ReportIPL 2026: Rajasthan Royals have reportedly decided to make Riyan Parag the captain of the franchise. The move comes after the exit of Sanju Samson from the Jaipur-based team.

Italy's first T20 World Cup win left some guys with tears in eyes: Coach DavisonT20 World Cup: Italy head coach John Davison revealed that emotions ran high in the camp, with players left in tears after scripting their first-ever World Cup win by triumphing over Nepal on February 12.

AUS vs ZIM Highlights: Zimbabwe beat Australia, bag massive upset in ColomboAustralia (AUS) vs Zimbabwe (ZIM) Highlights, T20 World Cup: AUS (146-all-out in 19.4 ovs) chasing 170. Zimbabwe cause the first upset of the T20 World Cup. They have beaten Australia by 23 runs in Colombo. What a day for Sikander Raza's men. What a day for the World Cup. Blessing Muzarabani stuns Aussies with 4/17.

Cricket nerd from 7, Gerhard Erasmus lives up to the Namibian spirit in KotlaICC T20 World Cup, India vs Namibia: Gerhard Erasmus walked the talk for Namibia at the Arun Jaitley Stadium on Thursday. He registered his best ever figures in T20Is, but was not able to take his team over the line against India.

IND vs PAK will be special, but not worrying too much: Ishan Kishan ready for Feb 15T20 World Cup: India batter Ishan Kishan emphasised how their upcoming clash against arch rivals Pakistan on February 15 will be a special one, but the team is not fretting too much on the fixture preparing for it like any other game.

USA batter calls out ICC over lesser funding for associate nationsT20 World Cup: USA batter Shayan Jahangir has urged the ICC to increase funding and exposure for Associate nations ahead of their must-win clash against the Netherlands in Chennai. He believes better support will help emerging teams thrive globally.

A slice of history: How a pizza-maker spun Italy to first T20 World Cup winCrishan Kalugamage once feared his cricket dream had ended in Italy's pizzerias. On Thursday, the leg-spinner delivered a spell for the ages, powering Italy to a landmark T20 World Cup win over Nepal at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Here's his story.

Matchday Preview: Injury-hit Australia eye successive wins to strengthen Super 8 berthDay 6 of the T20 World Cup features three key matches, with Australia vs Zimbabwe, Canada vs UAE, and Netherlands vs USA promising high-octane action in the global tournament.

Watch: Arshdeep Singh shares first glimpse of Abhishek Sharma after stomach illnessT20 World Cup: Arshdeep Singh's latest social media video offered a glimpse of opener Abhishek Sharma as India await clarity on his fitness ahead of the Pakistan clash on February 15. The opener is recovering from a stomach bug.

Asked about PAK spin attack, Varun Chakravarthy throws verbal googly at ParthivVarun Chakravarthy expresses confidence in India's spin attack ahead of the T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The match carries high stakes as Pakistan seeks to end their losing streak against India.

Ishan Kishan explainsT20 World Cup 2026: India's wicketkeeper-batter, Ishan Kishan, and mystery spinner explain how they prepare for the bowlers they are going to face. India crush Namibia in Delhi but spin woes remain ahead of Pakistan clashIndia secured their biggest victory in T20 World Cup history, beating Namibia by 93 runs at Arun Jaitely Stadium in Delhi. The win extended India's unbeaten streak to 11 matches in the tournament but exposed vulnerabilities against spin bowling ahead of the all-important clash against Pakistan.

Cricket on page 1? Italy coach hopes T20 World Cup win knocks off Winter OlympicsT20 World Cup 2026: Italy achieved its first-ever T20 World Cup victory with a dominant win over Nepal in Mumbai. The landmark result could spark greater interest in cricket amidst Italy's Winter Olympics dominance.

Prep for Pakistan? Gerhard Erasmus gives India a taste of Usman Tariq's unorthodoxyIND vs NAM, T20 World Cup: Gerhard Erasmus' unorthodox spell stalled India's pursuit of a 250-plus total in Delhi, but his variations may have offered a timely preview of the sterner spin examination awaiting them against Pakistan and much-talked-about Usman Tariq in Colombo on Sunday.

Hardik Pandya's Delhi fireworks ends after Namibian player's sensational catchHardik Pandya scored a brilliant 52 before being caught out by a stunning boundary catch from Dylan Leicher. The catch shifted momentum as Namibia's Gerhard Erasmus ran through India's middle order.

DDCA breaks silence on soft drink vendor's viral video from Arun Jaitley StadiumDDCA responded to a viral video alleging vendors reusing already-poured soft drinks for resale at Arun Jaitley Stadium. The video had gone viral on social media, sparking widespread concerns for fans.

Sanju Samson dazzles briefly, but misses golden opportunity against NamibiaT20 World Cup, IND vs NAM: Sanju Samson scored 22 runs off eight balls against Namibia but missed a golden opportunity to convert his start into a big score at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
